commander.name: Major-General Ivor Hughes
commander.previous_service: Commanded 131st Infantry Brigade until March 1942, succeeded Brian Horrocks as GOC 44th Division

command.headquarters_location: Tunisia Campaign - withdrawn from combat for disbandment

Ordnance QF 25-pounder Gun-Howitzer.note: Reduced from three field regiments - equipment casualties from El Alamein

Ordnance QF 6-pounder (57mm).note: Modern anti-tank gun - minor losses from El Alamein combat

supply_logistics.supply_status: ADEQUATE - Division withdrawn from front line duties in preparation for disbandment. No longer receiving priority resupply. Equipment transferred to other formations.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Libyan/Tunisian border area - coastal plain and rocky desert. Division withdrawn from combat operations.

subordinate_units.note: Transferred to 7th Armoured Division on 1 November 1942. Continued fighting in North African Campaign through May 1943. NOT disbanded with division.
Dispersed 31 January 1943 - battalions transferred to British Indian Army brigades
Dispersed 31 January 1943 - battalions transferred to British Indian Army brigades

tactical_doctrine.role: Division withdrawn from combat and disbanded 31 January 1943. Final operational period November 1942 - January 1943 pursuing Axis forces after El Alamein.
special_capabilities: Combat-proven division after El Alamein battle
Territorial Army units with strong regional cohesion (Home Counties)
Desert warfare experience gained through El Alamein and pursuit
tactical_innovations: Gained desert warfare experience at El Alamein
Adapted to mobile desert operations during pursuit phase
Integration with veteran formations in XIII Corps
known_issues: Division disbanded 31 January 1943 - component brigades dispersed
131st Brigade detached to 7th Armoured Division 1 November 1942
Personnel and equipment losses from El Alamein not fully replaced
Reduced strength after 3 months of continuous operations
Territorial Army division structure deemed redundant after brigade detachment
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division gained significant desert warfare experience through El Alamein (October-November 1942) and pursuit operations (November 1942 - January 1943). Adapted to mobile desert operations, but disbanded before full desert acclimatization could be achieved. 131st Brigade continued independently with 7th Armoured Division.

scenario_suitability: 131st Brigade operations with 7th Armoured Division (continued through Tunisia Campaign)
Mixed-experience division transitioning from green to regular status
special_rules: Division disbanded 31 January 1943 - historical end point
131st Brigade available separately in 7th Armoured Division scenarios
historical_engagements: Pursuit after Second Battle of El Alamein (November-December 1942)
Division disbanded 31 January 1943 at end of 1943-Q1

source: Brigade dispersal: 132nd and 133rd Brigades to British Indian Army brigades
131st Brigade transfer: Attached to 7th Armoured Division 1 November 1942
Equipment and personnel estimates based on 1942-Q4 data with combat attrition
required_field_gaps: exact personnel strength (estimated with ~7% attrition from Q4 1942)
exact vehicle allocations (estimated with ~7% losses from combat)

disbandment_details.reason: Division disbanded 31 January 1943 - historical fact documented in unit histories
disbandment_details.mitigation: None needed - disbandment confirmed in primary sources

personnel_and_equipment.reason: Specific TO&E for January 1943 not available. Estimated from 1942-Q4 baseline with ~7% combat attrition from El Alamein and pursuit operations (Nov 1942 - Jan 1943)
sources_checked: Standard attrition rates for 3 months operations
personnel_and_equipment.estimate_method: 1942-Q4 baseline (17,500 personnel) reduced by ~7% for combat casualties and normal attrition = ~16,200 personnel. Equipment similarly reduced.
personnel_and_equipment.mitigation: Access War Office records for January 1943 division strength returns

operational_details.reason: Specific operations November 1942 - January 1943 not fully documented. Division participated in pursuit after El Alamein but detailed actions not found.
operational_details.mitigation: Access XIII Corps and 44th Division war diaries at UK National Archives

brigade_commanders.reason: Brigade commander names not found in available sources for Q1 1943
brigade_commanders.mitigation: Regimental histories for Queen's, Royal West Kent, and Royal Sussex regiments

notes: CRITICAL: Division disbanded 31 January 1943 - This is the FINAL quarter for the 44th Infantry Division
Q1 1943: Division existed 1-31 January 1943 only (disbanded end of month)
131st Brigade detached 1 November 1942 to 7th Armoured Division - continued through Tunisia Campaign
132nd and 133rd Brigades dispersed 31 January 1943 - battalions to British Indian Army brigades
Personnel reduced ~7% from Q4 1942 due to El Alamein casualties and 3 months attrition
Equipment reduced similarly due to combat losses and wear
Division location: Withdrawn from front line in Libya/Tunisia border area for disbandment
Tier 2 classification due to estimated personnel/equipment, missing operational details, and disbandment complexity
Seed file lists 1943-Q2 for 44th Division but this is INCORRECT - division did not exist in Q2 1943

discovered_units.source: 44th Division history - brigade detached to 7th Armoured Division November 1942
discovered_units.reason: Brigade continued fighting independently after parent division disbanded. Remained with 7th Armoured Division through Tunisia Campaign ending May 1943.
discovered_units.combat_evidence: 131st Brigade fought with 7th Armoured Division in Tunisia Campaign (January-May 1943), including operations at Mareth Line, Wadi Akarit, and final Axis surrender in Tunisia. Brigade took part in North African Campaign culminating in May 1943 with capture of ~250,000 Axis POWs.
